item.title: JNDI - Understand
item.description: hljs.initHighlightingOnLoad(); What we have in this post: Overview Use cases Samples Source code Let’s begin Overview The Java Naming and Directory Interface (JNDI) is a Java API for a directory service that allows Java software clients to discover and look up data and resources (in the form of Java objects) via a name. SPI: Service Provider Interface API: Application Programing Interface The information looked up via JNDI may be supplied by a server, a flat file, or a database; the choice is up to the implementation used.
